question: 101. You have a CloudFront distribution setup, but you are not seeing any performance benefit to your users. What might be possible causes for the lack of benefit? (Choose two.)
options: B. The expiration period is set so low that caching is not happening enough to benefit users. Raise the expiration period time.
D. Users are not close enough to edge locations to see a benefit from CloudFront.
A. Users do not have CloudFront enabled in their client applications and are therefore not getting the benefits of the CloudFront distribution. Enable CloudFront in their client applications.
C. Your set of origin servers is too small and being flooded by requests from CloudFront. Consider increasing the number or processing power of origin servers.
answers: B. The expiration period is set so low that caching is not happening enough to benefit users. Raise the expiration period time.
C. Your set of origin servers is too small and being flooded by requests from CloudFront. Consider increasing the number or processing power of origin servers.

question: 102. Why would you set the expiration period to 0 on a CloudFront distribution?
options: C. To reduce the chances of a DDoS attack on your edge locations
B. To ensure caching does not occur for maximum throughput
A. To expire all content on all existing edge locations
D. To ensure the most up-to-date content is served at all edge locations
answers: A. To expire all content on all existing edge locations

question: 103. How can you delete a file from an edge location? (Choose two.)
options: D. Delete the file from your CloudFront distribution using the AWS CLI.
A. Use the AWS console to navigate to the edge location and delete the file.
C. Remove the file from your origin servers.
B. Set the expiration period to 0 on your distribution.
answers: C. Remove the file from your origin servers.
B. Set the expiration period to 0 on your distribution.

question: 104. Which is the correct order of the steps below to remove a file from an edge location immediately with the least interruption to existing service?
options: D. First, remove the file from the origin servers; then take the CloudFront distribution offline.
B. First take the CloudFront distribution offline; then remove the file from the origin servers.
A. First set the expiration time on a CloudFront distribution to 0; then remove the file from the origin servers.
C. First remove the file from the origin servers; then set the expiration time on the CloudFront distribution to 0.
answers: C. First remove the file from the origin servers; then set the expiration time on the CloudFront distribution to 0.

question: 105. Which of the following immediately removes an object from all edge locations?
options: A. Removing the object from all origin servers
C. Removing the object using the invalidation API
B. Removing all CloudFront edge locations with the object cached
answers: C. Removing the object using the invalidation API

question: 106. Which of the following provides the highest availability for critical files?
107. Which of the following storage classes has the lowest first byte latency?
108. Which of the following storage classes provides the fastest data retrieval speeds?
109. How long does a typical Glacier data retrieval take?
110. Why would you choose S3-IA over S3?
options: B. You want to save money and don’t need your data as frequently.
A. You want to save money and don’t need your data as quickly.
D. You want to save money and don’t need fault tolerance of your data.
C. You want to save money and don’t need data in multiple availability zones.
answers: B. You want to save money and don’t need your data as frequently.

question: 111. Which of the following statements are not true? (Choose two.)
options: A. There are more edge locations than availability zones.
D. The default expiration period is 12 hours.
B. An edge location is separate from an availability zone.
C. An RDS instance can be an origin server.
answers: D. The default expiration period is 12 hours.
C. An RDS instance can be an origin server.

question: 112. Which of the following is a valid origin server for a CloudFront distribution?
113. What does AWS call a collection of edge locations?
114. What type of distribution should you use for media streaming?
115. Which of the following are valid media distributions for CloudFront? (Choose two.)
116. Which of the following are valid direct operations on an edge location? (Choose two.)
117. Which of the following are valid use cases for using ElastiCache? (Choose two.)
118. Which of the following can ElastiCache be used for? (Choose two.)
119. Which of the following can ElastiCache be used for? (Choose two.)
120. What is an ElastiCache shard?
options: B. A collection of clusters in an ElastiCache distribution
A. A collection of multiple nodes that make up a cluster
C. A collection of edge locations in an ElastiCache distribution
D. A single node in a cluster
answers: A. A collection of multiple nodes that make up a cluster
